report_title: Industry at a Glance: Plant & Flower Growing in the US
executive_summary: Plant and flower growers have contended with volatile agricultural prices, weakening demand from florists and an influx of low-cost imports through the end of 2023. However, COVID-19 led to a plant and flower growth surge due to a demand for home improvement materials and landscaping services. Also, plant and flower growers occupy a position of strong bargaining power in the supply chain, selling primary products predominantly to wholesales but, more importantly, not to processors. Amid the pandemic, agricultural operators who sold primarily to processors endured stiff price drops due to bottlenecks in processing capacity, causing raw inputs to flood the farm gate. This was different for growers in this industry. In turn, plant and flower grower revenue has increased by a CAGR of 3.2% to reach $19.3 billion over the five years to 2024, including a 1.2% drop in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Strong demand and inflation boosted revenue in 2020. As people faced lockdowns across the globe, social distancing measures and work-from-home mandates, consumer behavior shifted, substantially influencing market trends. Although demand from florists dropped mainly as states shut down nonessential businesses, like retail and restaurants, demand from consumers increased significantly. With more time spent at home, consumers purchased plants and flowers to beautify their living spaces. Additionally, the pandemic led to a surge in gardening as a hobby, further driving demand for plants and flowers from nurseries and garden centers. Revenue is expected to increase 5.8% in 2020 alone.

The table shows the price increase for plants and flowers over the past few years. Prices have been rising steadily, with an expected 3.2% increase in 2020 due to inflationary pressures from higher costs of labor, fertilizers, and freight.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: By the end of 2029, plant and flower grower revenue will build slowly as prices gradually increase and conditions normalize. International trade conditions will likely be similar, though imports will inch downward, easing domestic competition by a degree, while industry exports will only marginally accelerate. Demand from florists will continue weakening. Thus, revenue for plant and flower growers will increase by a CAGR of 0.6% to $19.9 billion through the end of 2029, with profit remaining relatively steady at 5.3%.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Consumers Expand Their Desire for Low-Cost Imports
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The value of imports climbed during the period due to low-cost products from major floriculture-producing nations such as the Netherlands. Demand for imports is also influenced by natural disasters. Adverse weather conditions harm the quality and volume of plants and flowers and, in turn, reliance on imports grows. South American countries, particularly Colombia and Ecuador, are major sources of imports for cut flowers. These countries have favorable weather conditions and inexpensive labor that facilitate the sale of flowers at a much lower price than domestic flower growers. Due to a pullback in international trade in 2020 during COVID-19, domestic price conditions tightened slightly, which helped plant and flower growers with contracts with these distributors.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: For Hobby or Home Improvement Purposes Shot Up
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With many consumers stuck working from home, home improvement trends accelerated, pushing prices of associated goods and services, including lumber, landscaping, plants and flowers. Downstream retailers, like Walmart and Home Depot, set low prices, aiding the dispersal of plants and flowers on the market and contracting import competition.

industry_definition: Plant and flower growers produce horticulture and floriculture plants for sale. They grow nursery plants, including trees and shrubs; flowering plants, like foliage plants, cut flowers, flower seeds and ornamentals; and short rotation woody trees, like Christmas trees and cottonwoods. These plants can be grown under cover or in an open field.
key_trends: Price is a key competitive factor for growers because floriculture and nursery crops are largely homogeneous compared with manufactured goods.
Although price remains a critical competitive factor, the importance of quality is also expanding.

International plant and flower grocers compete with nursery and floriculture producers in other countries. In this international marketplace, domestic plant and flower growers benefit from their reputation as high-quality producers.
Boosted leisure time amid COVID-19 expanded consumers' desire to purchase plants and flowers.
Demand from florists will grow alongside consumer spending and time spent on leisure and sports.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Floriculture and nursery stocks in the United States are sold to wholesalers, retailers, and exporters in downstream markets and are also sold for propagation and reseeding purposes. This market segment spiked during COVID-19 because of many retail establishment closures. Plant and flower growers could sell to wholesalers.

The retail market for nursery and floriculture products has two distinct subsegments: the traditional florist market, characterized by high-quality products and more services, and the mass market, focused on higher volumes, smaller products and lower prices.
Intra-industry sales occur between plant and flower growers. As wholesale revenue drops, revenue derived from intra-industry transactions will shoot up.

products_and_services.product_description: Floriculture comprises the largest segment. Floriculture production includes bedding plants, herbaceous perennials, cut flowers, cultivated greens, foliage plants, potted flowers, flower seeds, and bulbs.

tier_1_suppliers: Farm, Lawn & Garden Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Water Supply & Irrigation Systems in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Tractors & Agricultural Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Coal & Natural Gas Power in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Nursery and flower producers rely on orders from florists
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Nursery and flower producers rely on orders from florists in the retail sector. Retailers will respond to a boost in consumer demand by expanding flower orders, pushing up industry activity.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Strong Dollar Leads to Less Expensive Imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: To supplement domestic production, the United States imports flowers and plants each year, primarily sourced from Colombia, Canada, Ecuador, and the Netherlands.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The United States Imports From an Expansive Geographic Region
international_trade_points.trade_description: Colombia mainly exports cut flowers to the United States, while Canada predominantly produces live plants and trees.

international_trade_points.trade_title: CANADA DOMINATES THE PLANT AND FLOWER EXPORT MARKET FOR THE UNITED STATES
international_trade_points.trade_description: Canada is a member of the United States, Mexico, Canada Agreement (USMCA), which minimizes trade barriers between member nations.

international_trade_points.trade_title: THE DOLLAR'S APPRECIATION WILL HINDER EXPORTS
international_trade_points.trade_description: Actual costs for exporting plants and flowers will surge as global economic health stabilizes in 2023 and the dollar appreciates.

business_locations.location_description: Temperate Climates in Southeastern Cities Boost Plant and Flower Growth.
The West's Favorable Climate Also Encourages Plant and Flower Growers to Locate There.
Growers in the Mid-Atlantic Resort to Greenhouses and Nurseries Because of Unpredictable Weather.

regulations_points.regulation_description: At the national level, regulatory agencies like the US Environmental Protection Agency monitor the environmental effects of growing crops.
Farmers wishing to promote their produce as organic must obtain certification from the USDA.
In response to CDC guidance, various levels of regulation were implemented in the United States to discourage public gatherings.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Investment is necessary for real estate, greenhouse construction, cooling rooms and the wide range of equipment and machinery required for plant and flower production.

basis_points.basis_title: Price is a key competitive factor
basis_points.basis_description: Price is a key competitive factor for growers because floriculture and nursery crops are largely homogeneous compared with manufactured goods.
Although price remains a critical competitive factor, the importance of quality is also expanding.
In this international marketplace, domestic plant and flower growers benefit from their reputation as high-quality producers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Many plant and flower growers are national, regional and local nursery businesses. However, small, family-run operations dominate the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: EXPANDING LABORIOUS TASKS BOOST WAGE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Demand for plants and flowers remained high amid the pandemic, necessitating hiring more employees and paying more wages in 2020.
Costs included in this category are pesticides, fertilizer, plants, seeds, potting materials, soil nutrients, conditioners and packaging materials.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Despite technological advancements, plant and flower growing remains a labor-intensive enterprise.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Volatile commodity prices influence fluctuating revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: Plant and flower growers are exposed to price fluctuations.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Weather conditions harvest volatility for outdoor plant and flower growers
volatility_points.volatility_description: Adverse weather can impact the quality and quantity of the flower harvest.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: GROWERS ARE SEEKING INNOVATIVE TECHNIQUES TO BETTER MEET CONSUMER DEMAND
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Plant and flower growers are working to improve the vase life for cut flowers and flower life for potted plants.

FAQs.question: What's an essential strategy for plant and flower growers to boost sales and marketing?
FAQs.answer: Plant and flower growers can boost sales by leveraging digital marketing by creating an online presence.

FAQs.question: How does your company navigate market risk?
FAQs.answer: Farms that sell to various end markets will be subject to less market risk.
